article.headline: Villanova 86, Albany 72
article.story: VILLANOVA, Pa. (AP) -- Allan Ray scored 17 of his 26 points in the second half and Curtis Sumpter had 23 points and nine rebounds as Villanova defeated Albany 86-72 on Wednesday night. Randy Foye also had 23 points for the Wildcats (5-1), who connected on 31-of-54 shots. Jamar Wilson had 19 points and Lucious Jordan added 16 for the Great Danes (4-4), who made 11-of-21 3-point attempts in scoring the most points against Villanova this season. Villanova took its biggest lead, 68-50, on a 3-pointer by Ray with 9:31 left to play, but Albany then went on an 18-5 run and closed to 73-68 on a 3-pointer by Brent Wilson at the 4:21 mark. The Wildcats responded with a 9-2 spurt, including a 3-pointer by Sumpter and a three-point play by Foye to end the threat. Albany trailed 28-18 with five minutes left in the first half but went on a 14-5 run, including two 3-pointers by Jordan, to trail 33-32 at halftime. The game was the first ever for Albany against Villanova. The America East team will visit another Big East team, Syracuse, on Dec. 28.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
